description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft Management Console remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-43572), it is essential to apply the relevant updates provided by Microsoft.

1. Identify your current Windows version and build.
2. Download the appropriate update packages from the Microsoft Update Catalog using the links below.
3. Install the updates and reboot your systems to apply the changes.

**Details**:
- Updates are available for various Windows 10 and Windows 11 builds as outlined below:
  - Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044284
  - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044285
  - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044273
  - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: KB5044286
- For installation, you may need administrative privileges.
- For manual installation, download the update packages from the following URLs:
  - [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
  - [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
  - [KB5044286](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044286)
  - [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
  - [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)

**Preconditions**:
- Confirm that your system matches one of the affected versions listed above.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
